review: I happened to visit Dr. Sreekanth by chance, after some online research for the treatment of my father who had just undergone angioplasty in my hometown but was having a lot of other issues post the procedure. Dr. Sreekanth was immediately able to identify the issue as low electrolyte levels. At this point my father had lost confidence in his health and was having PTSD and anxiety, but Dr. Sreekanth spent the time to counsel him. I was happy with the confidence and decisiveness of his treatment. It was a critical condition so he immediately admitted my father into CCU and treated him for 1.5 days post which he prescribed medications and now my father is fit and extremely satisfied with the treatment he received. Also, as my father is getting older, he sometimes digresses from the topic when discussing his issues, which can be extremely irritating to some doctors. However, Dr. Sreekanth paid attention and was extremely calm and made sure my father was fully satisfied and had all the information he desired. I also discussed diet and nutrition at length with him and he gave us a lot of time to answer small questions about food habits. With Dr. Sreekanth's support, I've been able to switch my father to keto diet on a short term basis, which has greatly helped him in reducing weight and diabetes and improving mood. I want to personally thank him for being a supportive and calming doctor, who prescribes minimal medications and is ready to answer any and every question of the patient.
